Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2013 03:08PM - edited Oct 31, 2013 10:18AM by mimi32 Nancyjeanne - My children are 18, 11 and 10. We have been a 100% honest with them in an age appropriate way. I was TERRIFIED to tell my children. Afraid that I would say something wrong or that I would cry but I wanted them to see that I am "ok". I didn't want them to hear from someone else but me so my husband and I talked to them together. We explained that the tests I had done showed that mommy has breast cancer. We also told them that I would be having my breasts removed and getting new ones. My situation in talking to my kids is a little different. My mother in law has had both her breasts removed with no reconstruction. They are very aware of this so I was able to "compare" myself to her as in look at mama she did this and she's perfectly healthy (the healthiest 70 year old I know). I am very open and honest with my kids. I can tell you that the conversation was nothing like I feared, AT ALL! I wouldn't say it went exactly as I would have pictured it to go. Once I gave them the information I let them ask all the questions they wanted. I tried not to make it a "serious talk" because I didn't want to frighten them. It was a very light hearted conversation. I will tell you that they will ask more questions later than they will at first. I pray that you find the words your searching for to talk to your children.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2013 06:25AM mimi32 wrote: Mermaid18 - Good luck at your appointment on Monday. The many appointments and wait in between each one is emotional draining. Let us know how the genetic testing goes. CJ - My pre opp appointment is on the same day. Have you found information to help you in your research about sizes, types.... of implants. So much to consume in such little time. Nancyjeanne - the information on these boards has been a life saver for me. I have learned things I otherwise would not have known. It's given me the ability to ask questions and better advocate for my own health. jmfrankel - I know what you mean. It's disheartening that we all have to "meet" this way but having someone to talk to that is going through this is comforting. My family and friends have been extremely supportive but its hard to truly understand the emotions and fears unless you're walking the same path.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2013 09:41AM mimi32 wrote: I sure have missed a lot in the few days I have been off line. Welcome to all of you that I have missed. It stinks that we have to be here but it certainly helps to know we have a place to go where someone is going through and feeling the same way we are. I had my 2 week pre op appointment with the PS yesterday. The doctor addressed all the questions and concerns that I had before I even needed to ask. Appointment days are usually pretty emotional days for me so I try to preoccupy myself. I had a great dinner with my husband and my mother in law. A glass of wine (or two), great food and great company was just what I needed yesterday. Each passing day brings surgery that much closer. To say I'm not scared out of my mind would be a lie but I am sooo very ready to have surgery done and move on.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2013 05:24AM mimi32 wrote: I tried to scroll through the posts and update the list of surgeries. If I missed you will you please let me know. My mind is still very foggy from all the medications I'm on. Yesterday my mom gave me a sponge bath and then drove me to my sister in laws salon to get my hair washed. It sure felt good but boy was I exhausted the rest of the day. Hour by hour is different, but for the most part I am starting to feel a little better with each passing day. I have A LOT of swelling which makes everything feel very tight. I hope everyone is healing well. We have a lot of surgeries this week. Thoughts and prayers that everything goes smoothly.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2013 06:55AM mimi32 wrote: 6 surgeries this week. Keeping you all in my thoughts and prayers. HUGS to each of you. Keep us posted when you can. You got this!

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2013 03:08PM mimi32 wrote: I decided to come home last night after dinner. I had a really loud roommate who constantly had several guests and they carried on. I needed to be in a place that I could rest in peace in quiet. My ps was hesitant to send me home with the level of pain I was in after transferring to oral meds instead of the IV. I explained that I would not be alone so he said I could go. I must say that I have been in ALOT of pain. It's more of a constant sharp heaviness. (No clue if that makes sense). When I transferred to oral meds we had a hard time getting my pain under control. After almost 24 hours of taking pain meds every 2 hours (around the clock alternating between Percocet, muscle relaxer and IB) I am finally comfortable. I was not able to sleep in bed, our bed lifts like a hospital bed to so I'm not sure why but I found myself comfortable in the recliner. My wonderful daughter came home from college to take care of me. She slept on the couch in the same room and woke up every 2 hours to give me my meds. We made a list of what meds I need to take at what time and set an alarm on my phone. I noticed there are a few new people here. Please give me a few days to get your names added to the list. Good luck to all of you coming up on surgery and to those that have already had surgery I hope you are healing well. (Sorry I am still kinda out of it) Mimi32
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2013 06:17AM mimi32 wrote: I had my 1 week appointment yesterday with my PS They removed 2 of my 4 drains yay! such a huge difference. He said that everything looks exactly as it should. No sign of infection, my skin looks good, the expanders are where they want them to be. To me they seem to be a little high and out too far but she said most of that is just swelling. They want to wean me off the narcotics because of my issues with constipation so I am alternating between percocet and ibuprofen every 4 hours. I was in a little more pain yesterday trying to adjust to the new medication schedule. Hopefully we can get this constipation under control. They took my steristrips off as well. I did not look at my incisions because I wanted to share that moment with my husband. He continues to think that everything looks fantastic and his positive attitude helps me maintain my positive thoughts as well. I think that I am afraid of how I will feel when I come face to face with the image in the mirror. I was horrified when I saw my incision from my lumpectomy. I have looked down to see my incisions but for now that's all I'm ready for. I skimmed through the posts to find the new people here so I can update the list. If I have not added your name to the surgery list please let me know. I hope everyone is healing well.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2013 01:55PM mimi32 wrote: Allebasi- My surgery was just a couple days before you. I have made a couple trips out of the house to do some christmas shopping with my mom. I lasted a little more than an hour and I was wiped for the rest of the day. It felt good to get out and not be stuck in the house. I too have absolutely no appetite. I think it's partly due to this burning sensation I get when I eat/drink anything cold or hot. It burns all the way down when I swallow and then sends an excruciating pain across my whole chest. It sometimes takes my breath away and brings tears to my eyes. I recently found a thread here and I here it's pretty common. I force myself to eat at least 2 meals a day so I can try to keep up on my nutrition. Has anyone else had this sensation? jmfrankel - I was given a surgical bra when I was discharged that I was told I had to wear 24/7 while I have drains (crossing my fingers the last 2 come out tomorrow) I am planning on wearing a bandeau/tube top under my shirts for support. I have a couple sports bras that I may try as well. I'm not sure about showers as I still have drains and can only sponge bath but hopefully that changes tomorrow. Are any of you allowed to shave your armpits or use deodorant yet? I am still dependent on my pain meds? I hate taking medication and don't on a regular basis. Have any of you been able to reduce your pain meds or stop taking them? tae - I still have not looked at myself in the mirror. I just don't feel I am ready yet. Maybe afraid of how I will feel or how it will impact my emotional state. I have looked down and can see my incisions but I ams till afraid of the whole picture. Hugs to you! I'm glad to see that for the most part all of us who have had surgery are doing well. I hope you continue to heal quickly with out complications. For those of us still awaiting surgery stay strong.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2013 04:30AM mimi32 wrote: I think I need to talk to my PS about changing my muscle relaxer it just doesn't seem to help anymore. The tightness in my chest sometimes spreads to my shoulder and my upper back, makes sense I guess. I think last night was the worst night sleep I've had since my surgery. Somedays are better than others but I wonder if the cold weather is contributing to the tightness (it's 15º here). Sometimes I feel like I just want these things out! I wonder if I can/want to go through this for months! Last night was one of those times I was ready to throw in the towel. I have stood in front of the mirror and wondered if I would be ok without reconstruction. My feelings on that waiver tremendously so I know that I am doing the right thing no matter how frustrated I feel. I just keep reminding myself that there is a light at the end of the tunnel and I won't feel this forever. I'm only at 160cc's so I have a long way to go!! I pray that God gives me the strength and courage to conquer this step. My husband and I are headed to Florida for our anniversary next week so I'm looking forward to that much needed time away! Thanks for listening to me whine for a minute. My kids are off to school and the house is quiet. Think I may take a nice long hot shower. Hope you all are feeling well today.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2013 12:18PM mimi32 wrote: raynaj- I am 4 weeks post op and I have to say that the last week has been one of the toughest. My Dr's warned me that many people go through a period of feeling depressed and it usually sets in around 3-4 weeks post op. I have carried a very positive attitude from the beginning. Through testing, diagnosis, surgeries and recovery I held my head high and won every battle with the "self pity" emotions that lingered to consume me. Friends and family kept telling me that I had to allow myself to feel those feelings but I was so focused on getting through it and keeping my head on straight. If I'm being honest being anything but tough frightened me. Now here I am post surgery and one week after my first fill and I can feel myself starting to give into these emotions that I have been so determined not to feel. We are all going through a big deal, a HUGE deal. Our bodies are never going to be the same and our spirits will forever be changed (good or bad). Don't beat yourself up for allowing the emotions to run through you, in someways I think your braver than I am for doing so. You are strong and you will get through this. I'm glad you can find the support you need on these boards. It's what they/we are here for.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2013 06:16AM mimi32 wrote: mimi68 - running! so jealous! I was training for my first half marathon when I started this journey. It all came to a screeching halt after my first biopsy. Since June I have been on/off restrictions between surgeries. I plan to start training again as soon as I am permitted to do so which I know won't be until after exchange I think we all (at least a few of us) have reached a mental point where we are frustrated with the limitations we have whether they be placed by our doctors or our own physical healing. I think this is where the depression that my doctors warned me about starts to set in. There's nothing more depressing than not being able to do things for yourself and being stuck in the house. I try to focus on the positive. Focusing on the progress I have made no matter how big or small as helped me stay positive. Remind yourself that you will get there. We are all fighting one heck of a fight. I am so very grateful to have all of you. Though my friends and family are very supportive they haven't worn the same shoes. Be nice to yourself this is not an easy journey to walk.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2013 08:09AM mimi32 wrote: cateyz2- I completely understand how you feel. I went 8 days with out going. I first tried a suppository… didn't work then I drank magnesium citrate… nothing, My doctor had me mix mineral oil and milk of magnesia… still nothing. After all of that I had to do an enema. I finally went but it took several days to have full relief from it. I am now taking miralax once daily along with the stool softener . I'm no longer on pain meds but still taking a muscle relaxer. I sure hope you get some relief. It's very uncomfortable for sure. I'm not feeling so hot today so I'm just taking it easy. Listening to our bodies is definitely the key.

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2013 06:24AM mimi32 wrote: Hi CJ! I too am having skin sparring BMX and also not keeping my nipples. That was a tough decision for me as my PS and BS have both told me that I will likely not be a candidate for nipple reconstruction because I am thin and choosing to go bigger. From what my PS has told me he will be using the Mentor tissue expander as I have chosen to use Mentor implants. Other than choosing the brand I have no idea what I want but they told me I have plenty of time while going through fills to look at and touch different implants to help me decide. She said that they are their to help me choose whats best for me and mentioned the different dimensions they use to help achieve that. Its all been so overwhelming and the fear of making a wrong choice is sometimes very consuming but I have to trust in the doctors who are advising and taking care of me. It's nice to meet you as well
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2013 10:52AM mimi32 wrote: lstewart glad to hear your surgery went smoothly. Hope you are doing well. jmfrankel - thinking about you as you head for surgery tomorrow. lets us know how you are doing. If been keeping myself busy trying to make it through each day. I feel like I'm nesting. I haven't slept well for the last couple nights and I'm sure that's only going to get worse as the week goes on. I talk a lot about this board and the support I have found here. Even if I don't post as often as some of you do. I think about you all often especially as we all are getting closer to surgery. I'm ready to move on but I can't deny my emotions are lingering to consume me. Stay strong and stay positive ladies. We can do this!
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2013 10:35AM mimi32 wrote: My plastic surgeon said that we would go over about sizing at my 2 week pre op appointment. I have read a lot on these threads that has given me the knowledge I need to ask a ton of questions. teachingwithcancer - Welcome! I'm sorry you have to find yourself here but glad you have found a place for support. I am fairly new here myself. I was diagnosed September 20th. Though my journey started in June. I scrolled through these boards and finally got the courage to post once diagnosed.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2013 05:09AM mimi32 wrote: keets8 - So glad to here your surgery went smoothly. Hope you continue to recover well. Take care!

Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2013 06:06AM mimi32 wrote: I am so glad to hear that you are all doing well with recovery. I'm a little worried my surgery may have to be postponed. I got the flu 2 ½ weeks ago. A little more than a week ago I started with the respiratory symptoms (coughing and wheezing) I have been on 2 rounds of antibiotics already. I went back to the doctor yesterday and she started a 3rd along with a steroid inhaler. Praying, praying, praying this does the trick. I keep telling myself that surgery isn't until Tuesday. Fingers crossed!
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2013 12:14PM mimi32 wrote: jmfrankel - How scary! So glad that you caught it and are able to treat it before anything serious.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2013 07:31AM mimi32 wrote: Glad to hear you are all doing well with your recovery! How/where are you ladies sleeping?
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2013 09:27AM mimi32 wrote: nancyjeanne - I am not using deodorant and told I was not aloud to until all my drains are gone. I don't have any incisions in my armpits either. It's driving me crazy, my armpits stink! I don't sleep through the night either, waking up 2 -3 times a night. I usually only nap once a day and maybe a catnap after dinner. My husband had the day off work today so I decided I wanted to get out of the house so we stopped to see the little one I babysit, picked up a few things at the grocery store and went to lunch. Gone for 2 hours, I didn't pick up anything just walked and I was almost in tears wanting to come home. Definitely take it easy and rest ladies! I don't remember who it was that described the elephant on your chest. Heavy and tight but I was starting to wonder if I was the only one, wondering if it was the "normal" feeling. Good luck to all of you facing surgery next week. To all of you recovering keep positive and keep fighting your doing great!
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2013 04:10AM mimi32 wrote: Hello all! My surgery wasn't postponed. In a lot of pain but is manageable with pain meds. I find getting in and out of bed is very painful. All went well and both surgeons were pleased. I'm still at the hospital, I'm not sure sure if I'm going home today.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2013 12:02PM mimi32 wrote: just got back from my 2 week post op with surgical oncologist. She said everything looks great and I got my last 2 drinks out, no more drains!! They did find more DCIS in my right breast and my left was clear. Thank goodness I choose the route I did.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2013 05:11AM mimi32 wrote: cateyz2 - glad you are home and recovering. Thanks for posting the restrictions. My husband and I were just talking about this last night as we were unsure if/what they may be. There's a lot of new "faces" here. Welcome to all of you! This board and this site has been a life saver for me. I believe I have added everyone to the surgery list if not please let me know. Now that all my drains are out I am allowed to drive. Well I decided to go to the grocery to pick up a couple things yesterday. OMG that was harder than I thought. Driving wasn't too bad, though I certainly wouldn't think about driving during rush hour. Pushing the cart was tough. Got a good pec muscle work out. I came home and crashed for 2 hours. I have started to wean myself off narcotics and am only taking tylenol. Percocet makes my brain so foggy and I don't remember much when I"m on it. I hope everyone is feeling well and healing fast. Happy Thanksgiving to you and your families! We certainly have a lot to be thankful for
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2013 05:07AM mimi32 wrote: nancyjeanne - I have only driven a couple miles away from home. not on the freeway, not during rush hour. I'm not ready for that. The second time was easier than the first. I tried to do a little black friday shopping with my mom (she drove) but I only lasted a little more than an hour. I have ordered a lot of things on line. Your right it's just not the same. I have been pretty wiped out this weekend which I'm sure is the result of pushing myself the last couple days. So I will be resting watching the Ohio State/Michigan football game with my kids today. Go Bucks! When I get cold my muscles in my chest tense up really tight. Do any of you have this problem? allebasi - here is a link that explains what cording is. I didn't know what it was so I looked it up and thought I would share with you. http://www.breastcancer.org/treatment/side_effects/aws
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2013 04:55AM mimi32 wrote: KellyBee - I bought a few button up shirts for after surgery. I was given a surgical bra to wear after surgery that I had to wear until all my drains were removed. I just used safety pins to pin the drains to the outside of my shirt. I didn't like the drains on the inside because they were against my skin and made my shirts very bulky. I pinned my drains somewhere between my belly button and my waist. I know they are suppose to be lower than the insertion site. Best of Luck to you

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2013 01:40PM mimi32 wrote: I'm glad to hear that someone is finally listening to you and doing something for it. Prayers and hugs to you.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2013 07:30AM mimi32 wrote: MsJar such a sweet story there is nothing like the innocence and love from a child. I have a sweet story to share as well… my cousins son who plays college football told me that his team wore all pink for a football game in October for breast cancer awareness and he wrote my name on the inside of his arm band. instant tears! I think this year more than ever Christmas to me was about the little things (like this story) and remembering that the gifts that are given each day in the love from my kids, my spouse, my family, my home, etc. are so much greater than any wrapped gifts under a tree.  I hope that everyone had a wonderful Christmas and is feeling well. I am headed for my 3rd fill today. My husband final gets to go to a fill with me so I'm super excited for him to see exactly how it's done. All appointments previous to my fills he was there so I'm happy he final gets to be apart of this process too.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2014 09:44AM mimi32 wrote: I hope you are all doing well!!
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2014 07:25AM mimi32 wrote: mcbeach - I started with 120cc's at bmx. I've had a total of 5 fills. 3 with 40 cc's, 1 with 60 cc's and this last one was 50 cc's. I'm at 350 now and my goal is 500 - 600. Not sure if I will get there though. I'm pretty petite and I don't want to stretch  my skin so much that it looks bad. I have an almost constant sharp pain in my left breast that intensifies briefly with movement. I'm thinking it's either my muscle or nerve endings but it's rather uncomfortable and annoying.  I'm not allowed to run, do push ups or any exercise that requires me to start on my stomach. I can't wait to start running again but I'm sure it's going to be awhile. Once the weather breaks I'm at least going to start walking my miles.  Where are you going on your trip?
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2014 10:20AM mimi32 wrote: These boards and the communication with you ladies has been a godsend to me! No one understands or gets the feeling of this horrible journey like you do. I hope you all are healing well and moving forward in your path to being cancer free. Stay strong ladies!  Do any of you still have that feeling of having an iron bra when you wake in the morning?
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2014 06:06AM mimi32 wrote: Some of have stated that you are finished with your fills… I can't wait to be done.   I've been kind of a baby(40 cc's) with my fills and the first time I decided not to be (60 cc's) is when I started to be in pain and it's been over a week. My left breast is so very tight and I have a constant sharp pain along the bottom of the same breast that is really driving me crazy. I started with 120 cc'c and hoping to end with 500-600 cc's. I'm at 350 so I still have a few fills left.  How many cc's did you start with at the time of placement? How many fills did you go through to get to your finish?
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2014 04:25PM mimi32 wrote: Kimberly welcome! How did the fill process go for you? My surgery was 10 days before you and I am still filling. My left muscle is really giving me fits but other than that it's been pretty easy. Hope your doing well.

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2013 03:04AM mimi32 wrote: ladies who have already had surgery. What did you do for constipation? I have not gone since Tuesday and started to feel a little uncomfortable. I take 2 stool softeners a day and drink plenty of water. I'll get the urge to go but it's always only gas. Love that I /we can come here and ask these types of things. Lisa
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2013 05:34AM mimi32 wrote: glad to hear everyone seems to be healing well. Keets how exciting! I have my first appointment with my PS tomorrow and I'm hoping he will remove at least 2 of my 4 drains. Allebasi - I too drift off frequently. I was taking flexeral, percocet, stol softener and antibiotic. I am battling constipation so they want me to reduce my Percocet so I am alternating between that and Ibprofren every 4 hours. I have tried almost everything and still have not been able to go. Sunday I drank magnesium citrate (I think that's what it's called) nothing, hours later I used a suppository still nothing. I called my doctor yesterday and they told me to take milk of magnesia with mineral oil if nothing the first time try it again 5 hours later still nothing. So I am suppose to use an enema today. My belly is so bloated that I look like I'm pregnant. So between the increased pain from reducing my Percocet and the discomfort from being constipated I am a mess. My mother in law came in town till Wednesday. She is amazing! I am so blessed to have the relationship I do with her. She is a breast cancer survivor and also had double mastectomy (years apart). I think I have added all the new ladies to the list. If I have not added you please let me know.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2013 10:01AM mimi32 wrote: Great news Keets! I had my first fill today. I didn't feel a thing during the procedure. She filled both sides with 40cc's. I learned that I started with 120cc's. My goal is somewhere between 500-650 so I have a long way to go. So far just a little achy and tight but nothing too bad. Still restricted to lifting no more than 5 pounds, no exercise besides post surgery, only light house work. hope you are all feeling well!
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2013 01:09PM mimi32 wrote: allebasi - I read your post over the weekend but didn't have time to respond. I too feel like something is going to rip and the worst part is in my arm pit. I did not have any lymph nodes removed. Until my first fill everything was feeling so good. Since the day of my fill everything is very tight, pulls and is very uncomfortable even still 5 days later. I was only filled with 40cc's. Now that you have a reason for what maybe causing this feeling for you I hope your doctors or PT can resolve it and you can start to feel a little more comfortable.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2014 08:34AM mimi32 wrote: I too still have pains that are different everyday. This past week after my 4th fill has been a little painful than most. I started taking my muscle relaxer again and have taken a percocet a couple nights. My PS told me to expect week by week and day by day to be different while going through the tissue expansion process. The past 2 days if have been exhausted! I took a nap yesterday, fell asleep on the couch at 7:45 slept till 7 this morning and took a nap before 10. I haven't' slept that much since the first couple weeks following surgery.  Have any of you started exercising again? What are your restrictions?
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: mimi32 wrote: I got my surgery date Friday and I am scheduled to have a BMX with TE reconstruction on November 12th. Hoping to connect with others that are scheduled to have surgery in the same month. I didn't see a thread started for November yet so I thought I would start it. I have reached the point that all decisions in regards to my treatment and surgeries have been made and I'm ready to get it over with. Anyone scheduled to have surgery Nov '13? Here is a list of our scheduled surgeries this month. Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2014 06:38AM mimi32 wrote: mcbeach when is your exchange?  tangandchri - That's a perfect description.  I had my 5th fill yesterday and it does not feel very good. My left (non cancer) side is the worst. Its super tight and I keep feeling sharp pains. I should have 3 maybe 4 fills left but my PS said I will have to wait 2-3 months after my last fill until exchange.
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2013 11:48PM mimi32 wrote: This is why I love these boards! I have been having the same sensation that started a few days after surgery and thought it may be from the tubes they put down my throat but it isn't getting better so I was planning on talking to my dr at my post op appointment on Monday. Cold or hot liquids and sometimes food hurt like h***! I can feel them all the way down and then followed by a sharp pain that goes across my whole chest. It seems that Percocet relieves it so I try to drink/eat about an hour after taking my meds. I also drink water without ice not so tasty but it's better than dealing with the pain. So glad I'm not alone. Hope it gets better for you soon!
Posts.Title: Hot or Cold drinks and food, feel in chest on masectomy side vaper LindaKR

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2013 05:34AM mimi32 wrote: Thanks Ariom! The sensation is so excruciating at times I can't eat or drink anything. If I take pain meds and wait for an hour then I can. If it's room temp then it's not as painful so I tend to let everything come to room temp before even attempting. Hope this doesn't last too long.
